headline.main: A Powerful Combatant in France's War on Terror

lead_paragraph: Eleven days after hijacked jets slammed into the World Trade Center towers, the Pentagon and a field in Pennsylvania, France's chief antiterrorism judge, Jean-Louis Bruguière, was in Dubai negotiating the extradition of one of Osama bin Laden's most important operatives in Europe. Djamel Beghal, under questioning, had informed interrogators in Dubai of the workings of several major cells in Europe. Acting on his tips, the Direction de la Surveillance du Territoire, or D.S.T., the French equivalent of the United States Federal Bureau of Investigation, was monitoring apartments where plotters were preparing to bomb the United States Embassy in Paris.
abstract: intelligence: a powerful combatant in france's war on terror*
